<div class="case-study-card">
<h3>Fundraising Campaign Optimization</h3>

<div class="business-challenge">
<strong>The Challenge</strong>
A nonprofit wanted to maximize donation lift but lacked statistical evidence for targeting strategy. How do we know which prospect segments will actually respond to outreach?
</div>

<div class="card-content">
<div class="approach-section">
<strong style="color: #2980b9;">Approach</strong>
- Conducted randomized controlled trial on 50,000+ prospects
- Analyzed response differential across demographic segments
- Applied causal inference to isolate treatment effects
- Tested statistical significance at p-value threshold
</div>

<div class="impact-section">
<strong style="color: #27ae60;">Impact</strong>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">+21.2%</div>
<div class="metric-label">Donation Lift</div>
</div>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">p=0.045</div>
<div class="metric-label">Statistical Confidence</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

**Why This Matters**
The organization gained **evidence-based targeting criteria** instead of intuition-driven campaigns. Replicated across 3 subsequent campaigns with consistent 15-20% lift.

<div class="case-study-card">
<h3>Patent Portfolio Prediction Engine</h3>

<div class="business-challenge">
<strong>The Challenge</strong>
A tech company needed to forecast patent acquisition by region and technology area. Current forecasts had high error rates, making budget allocation inefficient.
</div>

<div class="card-content">
<div class="approach-section">
<strong style="color: #2980b9;">Approach</strong>
- Built generalized linear model (Poisson regression) for count data
- Incorporated historical patent trends, R&D spend, regulatory environment
- Validated model against holdout test set
- Created predictive dashboard for resource planning
</div>

<div class="impact-section">
<strong style="color: #27ae60;">Impact</strong>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">34%</div>
<div class="metric-label">Variance Explained (R²)</div>
</div>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">±8%</div>
<div class="metric-label">Mean Forecast Error</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

**Why This Matters**
The company **shifted from reactive to proactive IP strategy**. Patent acquisition budgets now aligned with data-driven forecasts rather than historical averages. Improved resource utilization by 22%.

</div>

<div class="case-study-card">
<h3>Consumer Preference Modeling at Scale</h3>

<div class="business-challenge">
<strong>The Challenge</strong>
A CPG company faced 2,000+ SKU combinations and needed to understand which product attributes drove purchase intent. Traditional market research was too slow and expensive.
</div>

<div class="card-content">
<div class="approach-section">
<strong style="color: #2980b9;">Approach</strong>
- Executed conjoint analysis across 2,000+ respondents
- Tested 16 product attributes with orthogonal design
- Estimated elasticity coefficients for pricing & features
- Validated findings with holdout validation set
</div>

<div class="impact-section">
<strong style="color: #27ae60;">Impact</strong>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">-1.8</div>
<div class="metric-label">Price Elasticity</div>
</div>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">2,000+</div>
<div class="metric-label">Respondents Analyzed</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

**Why This Matters**
The company identified the **exact price point and feature combination** that maximized profit. Implemented recommendations and saw 12% margin improvement on new product lines.

<div class="case-study-card">
<h3>Business Drivers & Operational Levers</h3>

<div class="business-challenge">
<strong>The Challenge</strong>
An enterprise operations team had 50+ potential operational metrics but didn't know which ones actually drove business outcomes. Spending resources optimizing the wrong variables.
</div>

<div class="card-content">
<div class="approach-section">
<strong style="color: #2980b9;">Approach</strong>
- Conducted key driver analysis (KDA) on operational metrics
- Applied regression analysis to isolate driver importance
- Ranked metrics by impact on primary business outcome
- Identified actionable optimization opportunities
</div>

<div class="impact-section">
<strong style="color: #27ae60;">Impact</strong>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">68%</div>
<div class="metric-label">Variance Explained by Top 3 Drivers</div>
</div>
<div class="metric">
<div class="metric-value">Top 3 of 50</div>
<div class="metric-label">Metrics Identified</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

**Why This Matters**
The team **eliminated guesswork**. By focusing on the 3 highest-impact drivers, they reduced optimization scope by 94% while capturing 68% of variance. Enabled faster decision cycles and better resource allocation.
